title: I go Mid first and Support second...

replies.body:
yeah thats because no one is queuing support but a large majority is queuing mid, as such when two mid queues get put together and both have a secondary that can be chosen it will roll a die to see who gets the secondary pick.

I would not be surprised if most mid queues also have say a top lane or jg second which would have been taken up by the other primary slot queues leaving only your support queue available thus forcing a 100% dice roll in their favor.

Easiest way to fix that would be change your support queue to something more popular so its less likely to be empty, your queue times will suffer as a result though.

realistically touching the support role is a mistake. if you want top you might as well queue for mid too, and vice versa. everyone knows if you're a "solo laner" you can go in either role and still be able to showcase your fully sick totally-unoriginal-at-this-point zed outplays which is of course what all the 12 year old yolos are doing

Thats why i play tankdred (kindred with just tank items and maybe some hybrid damage items (like maw)) 100% winrate so far across the 6 games ive played of it, might be onto a winner, AND it can be played top sup and adc with the same build just swapping armor for mr if there are more ap champs on the enemy team.

Granted if your jungler has a habit of killing the scuttle closest to your lane stacking can be a bitch until lane phase ends.

Looking to one trick pony out of bronze using it.

Im also in the process of theorycrafting a thornmail hextech build for amumu so i can do some mad proxying

but changing your support to a  more popular lane makes the queue time longer because no one is choosing support
therefore I always chose fill ;D
